name: Lightning reflexes / great fortitude vs power attack/ cleave or iron will - The Unbreakable by Stagmeister
author: King of ones

posts.author: King of ones
posts.content:
Hello all !

I apologise if this has been asked before and it likely has (but I could not find it), but I have a question regarding "The Unbreakable build" - Stagmeisters build I think ?

Is it worth switching lightning reflexes / great fortitude for power attack/ cleave even though there is no dev crit where I play, it seems like cleave could be worth it even with low AB?

Or am I "better off" taking iron will due to the horrible will saves?

Muchos gracias !
KoO

PS I am loving this build

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
You're right about it being a great build, but alas I can't take the credit for it: it's one of the mighty Valerfor's (I just burble on about it quite a bit). Here it is in full.

I don't think the Will save is horrible (I like to get all my saves to 20+, which this one does, and which are all boosted by 2 when in Defensive Stance), so I wouldn't change that - but it's a personal call. Likewise, it's a personal choice as far as whether to go for the other save boosts or go for Power Attack and Cleave.

You might be able to get both, though, if you went for 4 Monk levels rather than Rogue ones, as Monk levels all 3 saves equally, rather than just Reflex for Rogues, as well as getting free Cleave at level 1. You'd lose a few skill points, so you'd have to drop Set Trap and UMD, so, as ever, it depends on the builds you like - as well as knowing what's most useful for you where you play.

Glad you're enjoying it!

Cheers

Thanks Stagmeister and sorry Valerfor! yeah it is a lot of fun, it just seems to "work". I have been reading (and trying be better at) realising that sometimes passive abilities (+'s to saves) are better than active abilities in some cases and was just curious. Looking back at it, I actually don't think the addition of power attack is that huge as the build is very strong anyway and the +2 saves are likely to be "worth more" in the long run that an occasional extra attack.

As always though I appreciate your inputs. I remember a long time ago someone explaining how a +2 save makes a huge difference  in the grand scheme of things, i wish I had the article as it "Mathhammered" it quite well for simpletons like me haha !
Thanks again !
KoO's
